page.title: 06Ghosts at Penrose
page.content: Penrose is one of the most magnificent old farmhouses in West Cornwall.It was once a great manor,the greatest in Penwith,which,even today although robbed by time of much of its former grandeur,retains the grace of old age. Penrose was a house of piracy and smuggling which founded the fortunes of many of our great houses. Mrs Hoskins the wife of the present owner of Penrose talked about the trouble they were having with ghosts. "I felt a presence in the room,of a tall man,bending over the cot.I called out 'What do you want?'.There was no reply,but then I sensed he was standing over my bed.Although I could not lift my hand to put on the light,I did not feel afraid.But what was odd was that although the presence was that of a man,I seem to remember the rustling of robes."
